observation: I can see a country/region selection page with a dropdown that shows 'Select' as placeholder text. The dropdown has been opened and is showing a long list of countries starting with Afghanistan, Albania, etc. I can see many country options with flags and names. I need to select a country that is likely to be accepted by this financial/trading platform. From the visible options, I can see Germany which should be a good choice for an elderly user.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to select my country of residence. I can see the country dropdown is already open with many options visible. Germany appears to be a good choice as it's a major developed country that should be accepted by most financial platforms. I'll tap on Germany from the list.
ux_issues: The country list is very long and requires scrolling through many options
The font size appears small for elderly users
No search functionality visible to quickly find a country

console_logs: [warning] The resource https://fonts.gstatic.com/s/inter/v19/UcCo3FwrK3iLTcviYwYZ8UA3.woff2 was preloaded using link preload but not used within a few seconds from the window's load event. Please make sure it has an appropriate `as` value and it is preloaded intentionally.

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: The dropdown menu remains in 'Select' state and no country appears to be selected. The UI shows no visual indication that Germany was selected or that the action progressed the sign-up flow.
dual_diagnosis.diagnosis: The tap action on Germany country option did not register properly. The dropdown field still shows placeholder text 'Select' instead of showing 'Germany' as the selected value, indicating the selection event was not handled correctly.
